metadata.synopsis: Dialog with the Talking Skull in Wyrm Rock Prison.Belongs to a necromancer who died in this cell.He used a spell to bind his soul to his skull.Only interested in talking to prisoners, really.
metadata.how_to_trigger: BGO_Main_AReCon: oe wyr_imprisonWait for the talking skull to play an ADClick on the talking skull

0.speaker: Unusual Skull
0.text: 'Tis a most curious mind yond enters a prison cell of its own will.
0.context: NodeContext: All of the weird old ENglish is incorrect on purpose and should be spoken with great confidence

102.speaker: Unusual Skull
102.text: Alas, I speak only to the caged who cannot leave of their own accord.

84.speaker: Unusual Skull
84.text: Shouldst thee perform illicit acts, we wilt have much to break with.

31.speaker: Unusual Skull
31.text: Solve two riddles for me. A right answer, and I teleport you to safety. A wrong answer, and I teleport you to the guards.
31.context: NodeContext: All of the weird old ENglish is incorrect on purpose and should be spoken with great confidence

33.speaker: Unusual Skull
33.text: Thou hast returned? Mine own disappointment knows not its bounds.
33.context: NodeContext: All of the weird old ENglish is incorrect on purpose and should be spoken with great confidence

85.speaker: Unusual Skull
85.text: To the guards, as was mine promise. Begone!

60.speaker: Unusual Skull
60.text: To the guards, as I promised. Begone!

34.speaker: Unusual Skull
34.text: Answer two riddles. Be true, and I teleport thee to safety. Be false, and I teleport thee to the guards.
34.context: NodeContext: All of the weird old ENglish is incorrect on purpose and should be spoken with great confidence

37.speaker: Unusual Skull
37.context: NodeContext: All of the weird old ENglish is incorrect on purpose and should be spoken with great confidence

39.speaker: Unusual Skull
39.text: Thou didst answereth so wise. Tis doneth.

14.speaker: Unusual Skull
14.text: You answered me wisely. Off with you, then.

41.speaker: Unusual Skull
41.text: We shall speaketh at the most promising hour, but never ere.
41.context: NodeContext: All of the weird old ENglish is incorrect on purpose and should be spoken with great confidence

58.speaker: Unusual Skull
58.text: Must thy gaze pierce so deeply? Quite crude.
58.context: NodeContext: All of the weird old ENglish is incorrect on purpose and should be spoken with great confidence

82.speaker: Unusual Skull
82.text: How malapert. Must thou stareth so?
82.context: NodeContext: All of the weird old ENglish is incorrect on purpose and should be spoken with great confidence

1.speaker: Unusual Skull
1.text: Nay sir hides within me. I am merely a skull, nay more and nay less.

88.speaker: Unusual Skull
88.text: I call myself Marvin. Thou mayst do the same.

70.speaker: Unusual Skull
70.text: Unfortunate, nay, ineluctable, perchance evitable, to be confined in such immuring quarters.

45.speaker: Unusual Skull
45.text: Thou wisheth to escape the confines of this prison, doth thou not? I can holpest thee for the cost of two riddles.

19.speaker: Unusual Skull
19.text: Answer me true, and I shall telep'rt thee to safety. Answer me false, and I shall telep'rt thee near the guards.

40.speaker: Unusual Skull
40.text: I fly, yet not through the firmament. I bidst and biddeth and bidstseth farewell at night and welcome thee in the morn. I am part of thee, and follow whither thou guideth.

62.speaker: Unusual Skull
62.text: I am clothened and claddened all in black, and flee the light. Yet apart 't, I wouldst be nought. Name me.

53.speaker: Unusual Skull
53.text: Poorly chosen, mine cousin. The correct answer was 'a shadow'.

9.speaker: Unusual Skull
9.text: Thy freedom is yours - thy safety is not. Such was mine gage.

89.speaker: Unusual Skull
89.text: A shame - I thought you more clever. The true answer is 'a shadow'.

56.speaker: Unusual Skull
56.text: I promised to free you, and so I shall. But I did not promise your safety.

36.speaker: Unusual Skull
36.text: Marvellous deduction - a shadow, forsooth! And anon, riddle the second.

92.speaker: Unusual Skull
92.text: I am battered, but nev'r did bow. Mine coronet bears the blunt of endless blades, but I can nev'r move.

10.speaker: Unusual Skull
10.text: I nev'r did sweat, even when the summertide sun didst fully heateth mine brow. Name me.

95.speaker: Unusual Skull
95.text: An anvil, forsooth! Thou hast maketh me most fustian.

83.speaker: Unusual Skull
83.text: Is't thy will to forsake this decrepit cell?

44.speaker: Unusual Skull
44.text: Hence with thee, then. Savour thy freedom, for thou cannot claim 't still. Away!

57.speaker: Unusual Skull
57.text: Freedom is yours. Savour it, for there is no gift that cannot be reclaimed or ravaged. Away!

20.speaker: Unusual Skull
20.text: An anvil, indeed! You make me most proud.

96.speaker: Unusual Skull
96.text: It is time to depart. Are you ready?

30.speaker: Unusual Skull
30.text: Alas, thou speaketh nay sooth to me. 'An anvil' was the answer.

55.speaker: Unusual Skull
55.text: Yet thou didst answer once truly. I wilt teleporteth thee into peril - but not without reguerdon.

90.speaker: Unusual Skull
90.text: Alas, what tragedy. 'An anvil' was the answer.

2.speaker: Unusual Skull
2.text: Your first answer was correct, nonetheless. I will send you to the guards - but you will not go unrewarded.

66.speaker: Player
66.text: I am done answering these silly riddles. Just free me already.

8.speaker: Unusual Skull
8.text: Then begone with thee, and tradeth thy japes elsewhere!

91.speaker: Unusual Skull
91.text: Very good - your freedom is nigh. And now, the second riddle.

100.speaker: Unusual Skull
100.text: I am beaten and battered, but never break. My crown has felt the strike of endless blades, yet I can never move.

74.speaker: Unusual Skull
74.text: I never sweat, even when the summertide sun shines upon me. Who am I?

49.speaker: Player
49.text: This is ridiculous. Just get me out of here.

73.speaker: Unusual Skull
73.text: I fly, but not through the sky. I say goodbye at night and hello in the morning. I am part of you, and follow wherever you go.

13.speaker: Unusual Skull
13.text: I wear only black, and run from the light. Yet without it, I couldn't exist. Who am I?

86.speaker: Player
86.text: What a strange game you're playing. Who put you up to this?

32.speaker: Unusual Skull
32.text: The blame and the pleasure belong solely to me. A fine wizard I was, and a fine jester too, imprisoned for one night after a delightful rash of debauchery.

12.speaker: Unusual Skull
12.text: The spirit of a prankster had always dwelled in me. The game laid before you is born of jest, wizardry - and whiskey.

27.speaker: Unusual Skull
27.text: Such is mine own will. Once I did occupy this very prison after a night of most bacchanalian debauchery.

76.speaker: Unusual Skull
76.text: I possessed the spirit of a gleeker and the art of a wizard.

79.speaker: Unusual Skull
79.text: The merriment laid before thee is born of trifling jest, wizardry - and whiskey.

6.speaker: Player
6.text: You talk like a drunk poet. If you wish to converse, you need to speak plainly.

52.speaker: Unusual Skull
52.text: *Sigh.* Common is just so very - common.

38.speaker: Unusual Skull
38.text: *Sigh.* Common is just so very - common.

75.speaker: Unusual Skull
75.text: Very well. To rephrase: I will teleport you away for the cost of two riddles.

18.speaker: Unusual Skull
18.text: Answer them right, and I send you to safety. Answer them wrong, and I send you to the guards.

15.text: Mine own words are already as kersey as the travelling lamp in the summer sky.

98.speaker: Unusual Skull
98.text: Mine own words are already as kersey as the travelling lamp in the summer sky.

7.speaker: Player
7.text: Examine the skull. What magic is at work?

97.speaker: Narrator
97.text: *The enchantment is clearly the work of an advanced caster. The body may have wasted away, but the mind that inhabited it is imprinted on the skull.*

77.speaker: Narrator
77.text: *The enchantment is clearly the work of an advanced caster. The body may have wasted away, but the mind that inhabited it is imprinted on the skull.*

21.text: *You can't fathom how this skull could be made to talk.*

23.speaker: Narrator
23.text: *You can't fathom how this skull could be made to talk.*

42.speaker: Player
42.text: I'm not playing this game with you.

26.speaker: Unusual Skull
26.text: I say thou art malapert to stare. But peradventure thou art new to such custom.

4.speaker: Player
4.text: A talking skull? I must be losing my mind.

61.speaker: Unusual Skull
61.text: Nay, thy mind hath not betrayed thee. I am as thou perceiveth.
